document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Kraatz, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kraatz, G. (1857 a) Naturgeschichte der Insecten Deutschlands. Abteilung 1, Coleoptera, vol. 2, Staphylinii. Lief. 3 - 4. Nicolaische Buchhandlung, Berlin, 377 - 768 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 24 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Blackwelder 1943: 527 (species of the West Indies); Campbell 1993a: 6 (some species of the genus).
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Haiti , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , US Virgin Isl. (St. Thomas), Grenada , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Galapagos Isl., Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental .

bibRefCitation.author: Gozis, M. des
bibRefCitation.refString: Gozis, M. des (1886) Recherche de l'espece typique de quelques anciens genres. Rectifications synonymiques et notes diverses. Imprimerie Herbin, Montlucon. 36 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America.

bibRefCitation.author: Stephens, J. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Stephens, J. F. (1829 a) The nomenclature of British insects: Being a compendious list of such species as are contained in the systematic catalogue of British insects and forming a guide to their classification, & c. & c. Baldwin and Cradock, London. 68 pp. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 51800

subSubSection.paragraph: 6 species are included in this genus from Central America.
Key: Campbell 1991a: 78 (species group and species of North and Central America).
Central America: Mexico , Costa Rica , Panama .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental .
22 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Oriental , Australian.

bibRefCitation.author: Mannerheim, C. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mannerheim, C. G. (1830) Precis d'un nouvel arrangement de la famille des brachelytres, de l'ordre des insectes coleopteres. St. Petersbourg. 87 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America.
Key: Campbell 1991a: 13 (species group and species of Mexico and North America).
